chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

Goal:
〚 p 〛 = Zp

Premises:
nat2Zp_one = Zp_inj 〚 1 〛 Op eq_refl : 〚 1 〛 = Op
nat2Zp_invertible : forall n : nat, Zp_invertible 〚 n 〛 < -> is_gcd p n 1
nat2Zp_zero = Zp_inj 〚 0 〛 Zp (rem_prop 0 ((fun lemma : 0 = 0 * p + 0 <-> 0%Z = (0 * Z.of_nat p + 0)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 = 0 * p + 0) (0%Z = (0 * Z.of_nat p + 0)%Z) lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) 0 0%Z eq_refl (0 * p + 0) (0 * Z.of_nat p + 0)%Z (ZifyClasses.mkapp2 nat nat nat Z Init.Nat.add Z.of_nat Z.of_nat Z.of_nat Z.add Nat2Z.inj_add (0 * p) (0 * Z.of_nat p)%Z (ZifyClasses.mkapp2 nat nat nat Z Init.Nat.mul Z.of_nat Z.of_nat Z.of_nat...
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
Zp_zero_is_one = conj (fun H : Zp = Op => let H0 : proj1_sig Zp = proj1_sig Op := f_equal (proj1_sig (P:=fun x : nat => x < p)) H in let H1 : rem 1 p = 0 := eq_sym H0 in (fun H2 : rem 1 p = 0 => let H3 : forall q p : nat, rem q p = 0 -> divides p q := fun q p : nat => match divides_rem_eq q p with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in let H4 : divides p 1 := H3 1 p H2 in let H5 : p = 1 := divides_1_inv H4 in H5) H1) (fun H : p = 1 => Zp_inj Zp Op (eq_ind_r (fun p : nat => p <> 0 -> 0 = rem 1 p) (fun Hp : 1 <> 0 => eq_ind_r (fun n : nat => 0 = n...
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
div_of_0 : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> div 0 p = 0
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
bezout_generalized : forall p q : nat, {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l}}}}
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
div = fun q p : nat => projT1 (div_full q p) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments rem (_ _)%nat_scope
Zp_zero = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) 0 ((fun lemma : 0 < p <-> (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (0 < p) (0 < Z.of_nat p)%Z lemma) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z lt Z.of_nat Z.lt Nat2Z.inj_lt 0 0%Z eq_refl p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl) (let Hp0 : Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z := ZifyClasses.rew_iff (p <> 0) (Z.of_nat p <> 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.not_morph (p = 0) (Z.of_nat p = 0%Z) (ZifyClasses.mkrel nat Z eq Z.of_nat eq (fun x y : nat => iff_sym (Nat2Z.inj_iff x y)) p (Z.of_nat p) eq_refl 0 0%Z eq_refl)) Hp in let cstr : (0 <= Z.of_nat p)%Z := Nat...
Pos2Nat.inj : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat p = Pos.to_nat q -> p = q
rem_erase : forall q n p r : nat, q = n * p + r -> rem q p = rem r p
rem_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> rem q p = r
divides_1_inv : forall p : nat, divides p 1 -> p = 1
divides_div : forall q p : nat, divides p q -> q = div q p * p
div_rem_spec1 : forall q p : nat, q = div q p * p + rem q p
Zp_prime_invert : prime p -> forall x, x <> Zp -> {i : Z_Zp | i ⊗ x = Op}
divides_rem_eq : forall q p : nat, divides p q < -> rem q p = 0
rem_plus : forall p a b : nat, rem (a + b) p = rem (rem a p + rem b p) p
rem_mult_rem : forall p a b : nat, rem (a * rem b p) p = rem (a * b) p

```coq
remember (nat2Zp_one) as H1.
unfold nat2Zp_one in H1.
rewrite H1.
remember (Zp_zero_is_one) as H2.
unfold Zp_zero_is_one in H2.
destruct H2 as [H3 H4].
apply H4.
rewrite Hp.
unfold Zp_inj in H1.
rewrite H1.
Qed.

original: remember (nat2Zp_one) as H1. unfold nat2Zp_one in H1. rewrite H1. remember (Zp_zero_is_one) as H2. unfold Zp_zero_is_one in H2. destruct H2 as [H3 H4]. apply H4. rewrite Hp. unfold Zp_inj in H1. rewrite H1.
